page.title: 01FOREST OF DEAN-TYPICAL AREA.
page.content: This area is rural and hilly,densely covered with woodland with a dominance of conifer and small areas of deciduous forest.There are no farms. Upper Lydbrook is situated in a steep sided valley,disected by the B4234.It is a linear settlement Worrall Hill is SW of Upper Lydbrook,also a linear settlement on the side of the hill concentrated round a C class road which joins the B4234 and A4136 following the lower contours of the valley.The village of Brierley is fairly compact lying on the nothern side of the A4136.The area has picnic sites with carparking facilities,a disused quarry and in the SW corner a forest trail.A dismantled railway cuts through the SE corner.
